item.title: Join two or more videos on the command line
Installing Solus linux on a Macbook Pro 9,1 (A1286): PART 2
item.description: Part 2 of installing Solus Linux on a 2012 Macbook Pro. Part 1- simply booting the liveCD to even allow installation is here: https://stephen.yearl.us/installing-solus-linux-on-a-macbook-pro-9 Rebooting after install lead to, you guessed it, the Black Screen of Death again. Solus was installed, accepting all defaults (and therefore one humongous / paritiion), to /dev/sdb2, /dev/sda1 is the EFI partition on which rEFInd was installed when running OSXMacOS. ❯ lsblk NAME MAJ:MIN RM SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINT sdb 8:16 0 477G 0 disk ├─sdb2 8:18 0 473.

item.title: Create a bootable ISO of macOS Sierra
item.description: Playing with Solus recently got me to thinking that maybe I could live again in a Linux world, but rather than running Linux in a Virtual Machine (that would currently be Parallels 12 for me), what if I dit it the other way around? That is, run OS X 10.12.4 (macOS Sierra) as a guest and Linux as a host… Download MacOS Sierra from AppStore. Reboot. ❯ hdiutil attach /Applications/Install\ macOS\ Sierra.
